comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nidzica (current Polish name for the town) "At the beginning of World War I in 1914, Neidenburg was heavily damaged by invading Imperial Russian troops; the town was reconquered and rebuilt by the Germans after the Battle of Tannenberg in 1914."

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.militaryhistoryonline.com/wwi/articles/tannenberg.aspx describes the August 1914 Battle of Tannenberg. Neidenburg was part of East Prussia prior to WWI.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: neidenburg.hm-software2.de/server/hmlims/app/prod/script/... shows some pictures of Neidenburg and other East Prussian towns including some during the same period. A similar picture of this church is tagged inneres_zerstoerte_kirche
